text: Spirito Santo is a modern Roman Catholic church building in Urbania, in the Province of Pesaro and Urbino in Marche region, Italy. ==History== Opposite the cathedral, the temple was erected to remember the victims of the disastrous air bombardment suffered by Urbania on 23 January 1944. It was built at the site of an earlier church. Inside Augusto Ranocchi created a large mosaic memorial in the apse (1969) and in the bronze door (2007). The façade is by the architect Del Mastro.Urbania Commune, description of churches. ==References== Category:Roman Catholic churches in Urbania Category:20th-century Roman Catholic church buildings
title: Santo Spirito, Urbania
